name: SurajKumar Kadiyam Balaji
summary: With a solid foundation in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from Anna University, where I was a University Merit Scholar, I am currently pursuing an MS in Electrical and Computer Engineering at Northeastern University. My career progression from an Electrical Design Engineer at Tata Technologies, where I validated instrument clusters and reduced field failures by 20%, to a Teaching Assistant guiding graduate students, demonstrates my ability to apply engineering principles in both industry and academic settings. I possess a strong technical skill set in coding languages such as Python, Verilog, and C++, and I am proficient in software like Cadence, Matlab, and Synopsys. My projects, from designing a 32-bit ALU to simulating branch predictors, showcase my commitment to continuous learning and my capacity to deliver impactful results
introText: With expertise in Embedded systems, VLSI design, SoC architecture, and cutting-edge technologies, I thrive on crafting reliable and efficient solutions for diverse challenges.

closingText: My academic journey and professional experience are underscored by impactful projects, ranging from embedded systems to benchmarking advanced processor architectures. Aiming to innovate and excel, I combine analytical skills with hands-on expertise to drive meaningful advancements in technology.
